div.div: Feeling stressed by the COVID-19 pandemic? You are not alone. Call the NYS Emotional Support Helpline 7 days a week, 8am-10pm at 1-844-863-9314.

div.div: There should be no public use of the Fields & Playgrounds during this time

img.alt: Reminder that School Grounds are Closed to the Public Featured Photo

div.div: Cancellation of the June 2020 Administration of the New York State (NYS) High School Regents Examination Program in Response to COVID-19 Related School and District Closures

Any Student who is in need of working papers can still get them from the school nurse. Whether it is for the first time (14 & 15 year olds) or if you are turning 16 and need updated working papers you can receive them.
Please email Mrs. Spencer at PYA at lspencer@pycsd.org. She will then contact you with the process to get your working papers completed.
The PYCSD Wellness Team is happy to share the Greater Good's April Happiness Calendar with you. Enjoy!

img.alt: Families First Coronavirus Response Act Featured Photo

article.aria-label: No Child Hungry - Household Request Form

h3.a: No Child Hungry - Household Request Form

div.div:
The PYCSD will be providing meals for students during the closing of the district due to COVID-19. Meals are intended for students and you must register below to receive meals. Starting March 18th through *extended to May 15th* meals will be delivered to homes by bus. Each bundle will have 2 bagged breakfasts, 1 hot lunch and 1 bagged lunch per child in the household. Please allow 24-48 hours to be put on the delivery route.
If you have questions related to student meal requests please contact the food service office at 315 536-6781 or email dburton@pycsd.org.

Any families who are in need of child care services at this time can contact Child and Family Resources. They may be able to assist you. Special preference given to Emergency Responders and Medical Professionals.

The Penn Yan Education Association offers a sponsorship award related to participation in a school or non-school activity for which family contribution is required. Click the title for instructions on how to apply!

img.alt: PYEA Student Experience Sponsorship Featured Photo

div.div: If you have a student that attends the Penn Yan School District and have moved to a new address, please contact the school in which your child attends. A change of residency form and proof of your new address is required in order to change it with the District.

article.aria-label: Important Health Information (Click here for NYS Immunization Requirements)

h3.a: Important Health Information (Click here for NYS Immunization Requirements)

div.div:
New York State Law requires a health examination for all students when entering PreK or K, 1st, 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, and 11th grade. The examination must be completed by a New York State licensed physician, physician assistant or nurse practitioner. A copy of the health examination must be provided to the school within 30 days from when your child first starts at the school, and when your child starts K, 1st, 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th and 11th grades. If a copy is not given to the school within 30 days, the school will contact you. If your child has an appointment for an exam during this school year that is after the first 30 days of school, please notify the Health Office with the date. We suggest you make copies of the completed forms for your own records before sending them to the school Health Office. Forms may also be faxed to the numbers below: PYE: Kristen Bray, RN or Susan Pallar, RN Phone: 315-536-2331; Fax: 315-279-1246
PYMS: Allison VanKeuren-Harris, RN Phone: 315-536-7255; Fax: 315-279-1245 PYA: Lori Spencer, RN Phone: 315-536-4429; Fax: 315-536-4352
